name: Ayushman Bharat – Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PM-JAY)
description: Health insurance coverage up to ₹5 lakh per family annually for vulnerable families; cashless, paperless; portable across India.
eligibility: Vulnerable families as per SECC (2011)
how_to_avail: Check eligibility on PMJAY portal or call 14555; visit empanelled hospital with scheme card + ID for eKYC.

name: Rashtriya Swasthya Bima Yojana (RSBY)
description: Health insurance scheme for Below Poverty Line (BPL) families with smart cards, offering cashless hospitalisation up to ₹30,000/year.
eligibility: BPL families
how_to_avail: BPL families were issued biometric smart cards through state roll-out mechanisms.

name: Central Government Health Scheme (CGHS)
description: Comprehensive OPD/IPD healthcare for central govt employees and pensioners, including AYUSH treatments.
eligibility: Central government employees/pensioners & dependents in CGHS cities
how_to_avail: Enroll, collect CGHS card, visit Wellness Centre or empanelled hospital.

name: Employees’ State Insurance Scheme (ESIS / ESI)
description: Social health insurance for organised sector employees and their families, including medical, maternity, and cash benefits.
eligibility: Employees earning ≤ notified wage ceiling in covered establishments
how_to_avail: Employer registers employees, access services at ESI dispensaries/hospitals with Pehchan/e-Pehchan ID.

name: Ex-Servicemen Contributory Health Scheme (ECHS)
description: Cashless healthcare services for retired armed forces personnel and dependents.
benefits: Cashless OPD/IPD in ECHS polyclinics & empanelled hospitals
eligibility: Ex-servicemen & dependents as per ECHS rules
how_to_avail: Register with ECHS, get smart card, access services via ECHS polyclinics.

name: Pradhan Mantri Bharatiya Janaushadhi Pariyojana (PMBJP)
description: Generic medicines and surgicals at highly subsidised prices through dedicated Jan Aushadhi Kendras.
eligibility: All citizens (purchase-oriented)
how_to_avail: Visit nearest Jan Aushadhi Kendra or use app to locate one.

name: National Health Mission (NHM)
description: Umbrella mission including NRHM (rural) & NUHM (urban) to enhance equitable access to affordable healthcare.
eligibility: General population with focus on vulnerable segments
how_to_avail: Access via public health facilities like PHCs, UPHCs, HWCs.

name: Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram (JSSK)
description: Provides free delivery, diagnostics, drugs, diet, transport to pregnant women and sick infants up to 1 year at public facilities.
benefits: Free services: delivery, drugs, diagnostics, transport, diet
eligibility: Pregnant women and infants (as per norms)
how_to_avail: Seek delivery or care at public health facility; entitlements are automatic.

name: Rashtriya Bal Swasthya Karyakram (RBSK)
description: Child & adolescent health screening for four Ds—defects, deficiencies, diseases, development delays; includes referral and management.
eligibility: Children aged 0–18 years (Anganwadi & school-going)
how_to_avail: Screenings via schools/Anganwadis; referrals via district health system.

name: Ayushman Bharat Digital Mission (ABDM)
description: Digital health infrastructure with interoperable health IDs, health records, healthcare facility registry.
eligibility: All Indian residents requiring healthcare access
how_to_avail: Register for Health ID via portal/app; share at facilities.

name: Mahatma Jyotiba Phule Jan Arogya Yojana (MJPJAY)
description: Maharashtra’s state health insurance scheme offering cashless hospitalization for secondary/tertiary care (state-level top-up to PM-JAY).
benefits: Cashless care up to ~₹1.5 lakh + PM-JAY top-up to ₹5 lakh
eligibility: Eligible ration card holders (Yellow/Orange/AAY etc.) and vulnerable groups
how_to_avail: Visit empanelled hospitals with ration card or scheme ID for eKYC and pre-auth.

name: Bed Reservation via Indigent Patients Fund (IPF) – Maharashtra
description: Mandated 20% free or subsidised beds in private/trust hospitals; fund contributed by hospitals into central digital platform; quick access guarantee.
eligibility: Economically disadvantaged patients
how_to_avail: Call toll-free helpline; hospitals allocate bed from IPF fund.

name: Aapla Dawakhana (Under NUHM/PMC)
description: Urban primary care clinics offering free OPD, basic diagnostics, maternal/childcare in Pune.
eligibility: Urban poor and general public in catchment area
how_to_avail: Walk-in at operating clinic with minimal ID.

name: National AIDS Control Programme (NACP) – ART Services
description: Provision of free HIV testing, counselling and antiretroviral treatment via government centres.
eligibility: People living with HIV
how_to_avail: Visit ICTC or ART centre at public health facility.

name: National Mental Health Programme (NMHP) / DMHP
description: Mental health services including OPD, counselling, psychotropic drugs, IEC at district level.
eligibility: General population
how_to_avail: Visit District Hospital psychiatry department or DMHP clinic.

name: National Programme for Health Care of the Elderly (NPHCE)
description: Geriatric care services including OPD/IPD physiotherapy, home-based care through PHCs and district hospitals.
eligibility: Senior citizens (60+)
how_to_avail: Visit designated govt facility offering NPHCE services.

name: National TB Elimination Programme (NTEP)
description: Free diagnosis and treatment of TB via Nikshay portal; includes nutritional support via Nikshay Poshan Yojana.
eligibility: Anyone with TB symptoms or diagnosis
how_to_avail: Visit public TB diagnostic centre, register via Nikshay, provide Aadhaar/bank for DBT.

name: Ayushman Bharat Yojana
description: Health insurance coverage up to ₹5 lakhs per family annually for vulnerable families.
eligibility: Vulnerable families as per SECC database
how_to_avail: Check eligibility on PMJAY portal or call 14555, carry Ayushman card or ration card + Aadhaar to empanelled hospital.

name: Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PM-JAY)
description: World's largest health insurance scheme covering over 10 crore families.
eligibility: Families identified through SECC 2011
how_to_avail: Search on PMJAY website using ration card or mobile number, visit empanelled hospital for eKYC and cashless treatment.

name: Rashtriya Swasthya Bima Yojana (RSBY)
description: Health insurance scheme for Below Poverty Line families.
eligibility: BPL families and specific occupational groups
how_to_avail: Families were issued biometric smart cards to access cashless care at empanelled hospitals.

name: Mahatma Jyotiba Phule Jan Arogya Yojana (MJPJAY)
description: Maharashtra’s flagship health insurance scheme offering coverage up to ₹1.5 lakh per family annually.
eligibility: Yellow and Orange ration card holders in Maharashtra
how_to_avail: Apply using ration card and Aadhaar at empanelled hospitals in Maharashtra.

name: Janani Suraksha Yojana (JSY)
description: Safe motherhood intervention under National Health Mission promoting institutional delivery.
eligibility: Pregnant women below poverty line, SC/ST women
how_to_avail: Register at local health center/ASHA worker; incentive credited to bank account after institutional delivery.

name: Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram (JSSK)
description: Free healthcare for pregnant women and sick infants.
eligibility: All pregnant women and sick newborns up to 1 year
how_to_avail: Visit government hospitals/PHCs for free services.

name: Pradhan Mantri Bhartiya Janaushadhi Pariyojana (PMBJP)
description: Scheme to provide quality generic medicines at affordable prices.
eligibility: All citizens
how_to_avail: Visit nearest Janaushadhi Kendra; medicines sold at reduced rates.
geography: All India (Jan Aushadhi stores in Pune)

name: Central Government Health Scheme (CGHS)
description: Comprehensive healthcare scheme for central government employees and pensioners.
eligibility: Central govt. employees, pensioners, MPs, freedom fighters
how_to_avail: Apply for CGHS card; avail services at CGHS dispensaries and empanelled hospitals.

name: Employees’ State Insurance Scheme (ESIS)
description: Healthcare benefits for workers in organized sector.
benefits: Cash benefits for sickness, maternity, disability
eligibility: Employees earning ≤ ₹21,000/month in covered establishments
how_to_avail: Employer registers employees, ESIC card issued for treatment at ESIC hospitals/dispensaries.

name: Aapla Dawakhana (Maharashtra Urban Health Initiative)
description: Low-cost urban clinics providing primary healthcare services in Maharashtra cities.
eligibility: Urban poor and general citizens
how_to_avail: Walk-in to nearest Aapla Dawakhana clinic with Aadhaar or ration card.
